alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 9:43PM CDT until March 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CARROLL...WEBSTER AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 942 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located near Lodi, or 10 miles northeast of Winona, moving northeast at 65 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. The tornado will be near... Embry around 955 PM CDT. Bellefontaine around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Walthall. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
